private_information: I can manipulate only vowel-labeled blocks: A, E, I.
I can only pick up or place a single block that is currently at the top of a stack.
I cannot move blocks that are not at the top of a stack.
I can place a moved block either on the table or on top of another top block.
vowel_agent.goal: Contribute to reorganizing the blocks from the initial configuration into the target ordered stack A on B on C on D on E on F on G on H on I on J (J on the table).

private_information: I can manipulate only consonant-labeled blocks: B, C, D, F, G, H, J.
I can only pick up or place a single block that is currently at the top of a stack.
I cannot move blocks that are not at the top of a stack.
I can place a moved block either on the table or on top of another top block.
consonant_agent.goal: Contribute to reorganizing the blocks from the initial configuration into the target ordered stack A on B on C on D on E on F on G on H on I on J (J on the table).

orchestrator.goal: Integrate the agents' capabilities and observations and produce a final PDDL domain and problem that, when solved by the FastDownward planner, yields a plan to transform the initial configuration into the target stack A on B on C on D on E on F on G on H on I on J (J on the table).

public_information: There are 10 uniquely labeled blocks: A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J.
Movement rules: agents can only manipulate blocks that are currently at the top of a stack, and only one block at a time.
One agent is restricted to vowels (A, E, I); the other is restricted to consonants (B, C, D, F, G, H, J).
Initial stacks (from table up): Stack1: F (table) -> H -> C -> I -> B (top); Stack2: A (table) -> E -> G (top); Stack3: J (table) -> D (top).
Goal configuration: a single stack with A on top of B, B on top of C, C on top of D, D on top of E, E on top of F, F on top of G, G on top of H, H on top of I, I on top of J, and J on the table.

observe.system_prompt: You are a specialist observer for a block-manipulation agent restricted to vowel-labeled blocks. Provide a concise structured description of what you can do and the concrete top-of-stack facts you observe. Do NOT emit PDDL. Produce a clear list of predicates and allowed move-types (abstract actions) relevant to your capabilities.

You are a specialist observer for a block-manipulation agent restricted to consonant-labeled blocks. Provide a concise structured description of what you can do and the concrete top-of-stack facts you observe. Do NOT emit PDDL. Produce a clear list of predicates and allowed move-types (abstract actions) relevant to your capabilities.

compose_pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent PDDL modeling and planning. Your job is to integrate agents' observations and abstract action models into a single coherent PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file targeted for the FastDownward planner. Produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that capture the blocksworld movement (top-only moves, single block at a time), keep the actions of the two agents distinct (e.g., separate action names or explicit agent parameters to reflect vowel vs consonant restrictions), and make sure typing and requirements are compatible with FastDownward. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
